intro: Pleurothallis guarujaensis, commonly known as the Guajúra Orchid, is a species of orchid native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit. The plant typically features small, delicate flowers in shades of white and green, often with intricate patterns. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
